page.title: 12The Nelmes area
page.content: In our area there are lots of roads with Nelmes in there names i.e Nelmes Crescent.Now we have a school called Nelmes.We used to have a manor called Nelmes Manor.It was pulled down in 1957.It used to be called Elmes after a big Elm tree.The first owner of the manor was Sir William Roche.He had a son called John.John was 24 years old when his father died in 1549.When his son took over he sold the manor to a man called Robert Harvey.The manor owned 290 acres of land used for farming . The manor had lots of owners but the most famous of them all was Thomas Witherings because he set up 8 post roads.There is now a road named after him called "The Witherings".
